sentence.Network_en: My household duties were not particularly onerous.

sentence.Network_cn: 她希望有个固定的职业,不管这个职业多么繁重, 多么令人厌倦.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French onereus, from Latin onerosus, from onus, oner- 'burden'

entry.def: If you describe a task as onerous, you dislike having to do it because you find it difficult or unpleasant.

example.ex: ...parents who have had the onerous task of bringing up a very difficult child.
example.tran: 曾经辛辛苦苦地养育过任性难缠的孩子的父母亲

sentences.sentence: "the burdensome task of preparing the income tax return"
"my duties weren't onerous; I only had to greet the guests"

auth_sentence.content: Rather than the onerous demands put upon them today.
